title: UIC Nursing in the News
cleaned_text: News Faculty, students and alumni from the UIC College of Nursing are often featured in the media. In some cases, subscription may be required to view content. Highlights [Heading link](#highlights) Local News [Heading link](#local-news) NBC 5 Chicago| Aug. 30 [Cooking classes empower, improve health of women with hypertension](https://www.nbcchicago.com/news/local/cooking-classes-empower-improve-health-of-women-with-hypertension/3218216/) Assistant professor [Saria Lofton](https://nursing.uic.edu/profiles/saria-lofton/), PhD, RN, discusses the "Food is Medicine: Healing Together" program - a community-based partnership aimed at assisting black women with hypertension and obesity improve their health using cooking classes and nutrition seminars. ABC 7 Chicago| Aug. 6 [Gov. JB Pritzker signs legislation aimed at improving way IL schools address student trauma](https://abc7chicago.com/jb-pritzker-governor-back-to-school-nurse/13604728/) News about new legislation aimed at improving the way Illinois schools address student trauma featuring school nurse program director [Eileen Moss](https://nursing.uic.edu/profiles/moss-eileen-m/), DNP, RN, PEL-CSN, NCSN. WAND-TV | July 20 [Illinois lawmakers discuss shortage of school psychologists, nurses, and other personnel](https://www.wandtv.com/news/illinois-lawmakers-discuss-shortage-of-school-psychologists-nurses-and-other-personnel/article_cf5fa422-2748-11ee-b7d8-8b270d3fc128.html) News featuring school nurse program director [Eileen Moss](https://nursing.uic.edu/profiles/moss-eileen-m/), DNP, RN, PEL-CSN, NCSN, about the Illinois legislature's attempts to address teacher and school nurse shortage across the state. Prairie State Wire | July 2 [Durbin Visits Genesis Medical Center To Address Health Care Workforce Shortages In Rural Illinois](https://prairiestatewire.com/stories/645010289-durbin-visits-genesis-medical-center-to-address-health-care-workforce-shortages-in-rural-illinois) News about U.S. Senator Dick Durbin's news conference highlighting his "Roadmap to Grow Illinois' Rural Health Workforce." UIC Nursing-Quad Cities campus director [Kathleen Sparbel](https://nursing.uic.edu/profiles/kathleen-sparbel/), PhD, spoke at the news conference and is featured in the article. Chicago Sun-Times | June 21 [Food is medicine programs can improve health, reduce food insecurity](https://chicago.suntimes.com/2023/6/21/23767406/food-medicine-health-disparities-chronic-illness-wellness-nutrition-saria-lofton-lucy-peterson-op-ed) Op-ed co-authored by UIC College of Nursing professor [Saria Lofton](https://nursing.uic.edu/profiles/saria-lofton/), PhD, RN, about the benefits of expanding "food is medicine" programs in Illinois. NPR Illinois | May 16 [The UIC nursing program at UIS helps educate the next generation of healthcare professionals](https://www.nprillinois.org/community-voices/2023-05-18/the-uic-nursing-program-at-uis-helps-educate-the-next-generation-of-healthcare-professionals-community-voices) Springfield campus director Sara McPherson, PhD, RN, CNE, is featured in this episode of NPR Illinois Community Voices. Today's Times News | May 16, 2023 [These healthy habits might also lead to a happier life](https://www.tnonline.com/20230516/these-healthy-habits-might-also-lead-to-a-happier-life/) Rosalba Hernandez, PhD, associate dean for equity and inclusion, is quoted in this health feature. WBEZ Chicago | May 11, 2023 [The First 12 Weeks of Parenthood](https://www.wbez.org/stories/the-untold-stories-of-parenthood/20428a98-f09e-4fe4-babe-b296848ba2b7) Current PhD student and UI Health midwife Karie Stewart is featured in WBEZ's First 12 Weeks of Parenthood series. WGN-TV | May 11, 2023 [Around Town visits UIC College of Nursing](https://wgntv.com/morning-news/around-town/around-town-visits-uic-college-of-nursing/?fbclid=IwAR0BFrR_8_6tpCQSCotlGBMIWhLm7kvMwSYwH_kQYRdjCZfy6U7d9CEivS0) The UIC Nursing [Schwartz Lab](https://nursing.uic.edu/student-life/schwartz-lab/) is featured on the WGN Morning News segment "Around Town." - - more CBS2 Chicago | April 28, 2023 [UIC College of Nursing graduates celebrate with jump in pool](https://www.cbsnews.com/chicago/video/uic-college-of-nursing-graduates-celebrate-with-jump-in-pool/?intcid=CNM-00-10abd1h) Annual video coverage of UIC College of Nursing pool jump. NWI.com (Times of Northwest Indiana) | Feb. 2, 2023 [Northwest Health-Porter names new board members, chair](https://www.nwitimes.com/business/local/northwest-health-porter-names-new-board-members-chair/article_ccc61e3e-3d5f-5aa3-825a-de43419014f1.html) Announcing appointment of alumna Karen Allen, PhD '92, RN, FAAN, to chair the hospital's board of directors ABC7 Chicago | Sept. 21, 2022 [Nurse shortage could reach more than 1M by end of year](https://abc7chicago.com/nurse-shortage-2022-nursing-jobs-job/12248442/) Reporting on a shortage of nurses nation-wide featuring UIC Nursing faculty and students, who stressed the significant role the M. Christine Schwartz Experiential Learning & Simulation Laboratory played in preparing them for their future nursing career. Chicago Sun-Times | June 24. 2022 [This comic tells the true story of how Chicago LGBTQ+ house leaders, health experts worked to boost COVID vaccination rates](https://chicago.suntimes.com/2022/6/24/23176247/josh-neufeld-vaccinated-ball-comic-house-balls-lgbtq-covid-vaccinations-chicago-jahari-stamps) Featuring work—and comic-book style illustrations!— of profs Randi Singer, Natasha Crooks, Phoenix Matthews and Crystal Patil. Also ran on the front page of the printed Sunday edition on June 26. Ripon Commonwealth Press | May 24, 2022 [Ripon College names Victoria Folse as its first-ever permanent female president](https://www.riponpress.com/news/ripon-college-names-victoria-folse-as-its-first-ever-permanent-female-president/article_70eceefc-db74-11ec-9430-8f745216d949.html) Alumna Victoria Folse, MS '89, was selected as the first female president of Ripon College. Chicago Tribune | May 17, 2022 [Class of 2022 college grads wooed by employers, buoyed by hot job market](https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/breaking/ct-class-of-2022-college-grads-job-market-20220517-c3dmmjn4dbeejmtjz22xzwtghm-story.html) Featuring an interview with alumna Lisa Falen, BSN '22, and showcasing a photo and note about the undergraduate pool jump in Chicago. CBS 2 Chicago | May 4, 2022 [UIC College of Nursing students celebrate with jump in pool](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NVzIj9mvuzs) Featuring the Chicago-based graduatng senior class State Journal-Register | April 27, 2022 Jumping In (print only) Featuring the Springfield-based graduatng senior class's pool jump WSIL-TV | Feb. 10, [Medical District Innovation: Lab Gives Nursing Students Hands-On Skills](https://www.wsiltv.com/news/illinois/medical-district-innovation-lab-gives-nursing-students-hands-on-skills/article_bf32d72e-7c80-5c2e-aad3-60e9798631dd.html) with a collaborative [Illinois Medical District press release](https://illinoismedicaldistrict.newsroom-online.com/2022/01/31/medical-district-innovation-lab-gives-nursing-students-hands-on-skills/)detailing UIC College of Nursing's various clinical simulation resources, including the [M. Christine Schwartz Experiential Learning & Simulation Laboratory](https://nursing.uic.edu/student-life/schwartz-lab/). ABC7 Chicago | Dec. 17, 2021 [UIC, City Colleges of Chicago announce program to address nursing shortage, diversity](https://abc7chicago.com/nursing-shortage-bs-in-uic-university-of-illinois-at-chicago/11353232/) Coverage of new agreement between UIC Nursing and CCC that makes it easier for diverse nursing grads from Malcolm X College to complete their BSN at UIC. Illinois Times | Nov. 11, 2021 [The many sad faces of nursing home closures](https://www.illinoistimes.com/springfield/the-many-sad-faces-of-nursing-home-closures/Content?oid=14329112) Springfield campus clinical assistant professor [Susan Hovey](https://nursing.uic.edu/profiles/hovey-susan/), PhD, RN, is featured in thie article about nursing home closures. WREX-TV | July 26, 2021 [Inspiring profile of alumna Terese Knake, who was recently recognized by the Illinois Nurses Foundation as one of 40 outstanding, emerging nurses in Illinois under the age of 40. City of Chicago | July 26, 2021 [31st Anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gjJaQU85ta0&t=601s) Speech by Mayor Lori Lightfoot celebrating the 31st anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act, in which she recognizes UIC Nursing BSN student Stacy Wood The Pantagraph | July 26, 2021 [Business Achievements: Chestnut Health names Annie Robbins Mental Health Practitioner](https://pantagraph.com/business/local/achievements/business-achievements-chestnut-health-names-annie-robbins-mental-health-practitioner/article_4edda7e4-37ef-54f3-9599-1d6df3d61296.html) Local news story about alumna Annie Robbins, DNP '20, becoming a mental health nurse practitioner at Chestnut Family Health Center. The Pantagraph | July 10, 2021 [Couple endows nursing chair](https://www.pantagraph.com/lifestyles/health-med-fit/health-digest/article_17b6edf9-8d6c-5722-9a00-04506dc5f1c6.html) Coverage of recent gift to establish the Kathleen M. Irwin Endowed Chair Professorship in Outstanding Nursing Practice City of Chicago | June 15, 2021 [Recent Deaf Nursing Grad Vaccinates Hundreds at UIC](https://www.chicago.gov/city/en/sites/covid19-vaccine/home/blog/Deaf-nursing-grad-vaccinates-hundreds.html) Coverage of BSN student Stacy Woods' volunteer work to vaccinate Chicagoans against COVID-19 Block Club Chicago | Mar. 26, 2021 [All Humboldt Park Adults Can Get Vaccinated At This Neighborhood Clinic. Here's How To Make An Appointment](https://blockclubchicago.org/2021/03/26/all-humboldt-park-adults-can-get-vaccinated-at-this-neighborhood-clinic-heres-how-to-make-an-appointment/) Featuring the college's nurse-led clinic and quoting Charles Yingling, associate dean for practice and community partnerships Crain's Chicago Business | Mar. 8, 2021 [Crain's 2021 Notable Health Care Heroes](https://www.chicagobusiness.com/awards/crains-2021-notable-health-care-heroes) Honoring clinical assistant professor Rebecca Singer WBBM-AM (Radio) | Mar. 7, 2021 [UIC Nursing in QS World University Rankings](http://my.tvey.es/k7RMc) [Coverage](https://nursing.uic.edu/news-stories/uic-nursing-programs-rank-among-the-best-globally/)of newly released rankings for nursing programs globally Chicago Tribune | Feb. 18, 2021 [Inside University of Illinois at Chicago's mass COVID-19 vaccination site](https://www.chicagotribune.com/coronavirus/vaccine/ct-viz-uic-mass-vaccination-site-photos-20210218-uk2x5huujjabbpr7d7ixv2puwe-photogallery.html) The first image in this photo gallery is of DNP student Paul Antczak Jr. administering a vaccine Chicago Tribune | Feb. 18, 2021 ['In 22 minutes, everything was full': Thousands of Chicagoans receive COVID-19 vaccine at UIC arena as dentistry, nursing and medical students pitch in](https://www.chicagotribune.com/coronavirus/vaccine/ct-covid-19-vaccine-site-university-of-illinois-chicago-20210218-vpvha24q2bcrxmunkxyxjii5fu-story.html) Noting the efforts of UIC Nursing students at the Credit Union 1 Arena vaccination site Telemundo Chicago | Dec. 17, 2020 [COVID-19: comienzan a vacunar a personal médico en hospitales del área de Chicago](https://www.telemundochicago.com/noticias/local/covid-19-comienza-a-vacunar-a-personal-medico-en-hospitales-del-area-de-chicago/2141037/) Featuring undergraduate junior Freddy Lucena, who was one of the first Latinos vaccinated against Covid-19 at Norwegian American Hospital, where he works as a CNA WICS/WRSP (Springfield) | Dec 4, 2020 [Local program looks to lessen Central Illinois nursing shortage](https://newschannel20.com/news/local/local-program-looks-to-lessen-central-illinois-nursing-shortage) Featuring faculty member Sara McPherson NBC5 Chicago | Dec. 3, 2020 [Chicago-Area Nursing Students Gain Valuable Experience During Pandemic](https://www.nbcchicago.com/news/local/chicago-area-nursing-students-gain-valuable-experience-during-pandemic/2386151/) Featuring student Raquel Real Chicago Tribune | Nov. 29, 2020 [Waubonsee Community College announces partnership with UIC College of Nursing](https://www.chicagotribune.com/suburbs/aurora-beacon-news/ct-abn-aurora-community-briefs-st-1129-20201127-by4j7yogxfgsnlssliul2ar66m-story.html) Quoting Dean Terri Weaver WAND-TV (Central Illinois) | Nov. 23, 2020 [U of I students going above and beyond to help homeless population](https://www.wandtv.com/news/u-of-i-students-going-above-and-beyond-to-help-homeless-population/article_c80c8e72-2bc1-11eb-8691-1b7e6016a981.html) Featuring nursing students at our Urbana Campus (erroneously reported as "U of I") Kane County Chronicle | Nov. 20, 2020 [Waubonsee Community College partners with University of Illinois Chicago to help nursing students](https://www.kcchronicle.com/2020/11/19/waubonsee-community-college-partners-with-university-of-illinois-chicago-to-help-nursing-students/aiem8dx/) Quoting Dean Terri Weaver and Kate Tredway, director of the UIC Nursing RN to BSN degree completion program WILL / Rising to the Challenge podcast | Sept. 21, 2020 [Testing, Testing, 1, 2, 3, Testing](https://will.illinois.edu/risingtothechallenge/episode/episode-2-testing-testing-1-2-3-testing) Featuring clinical assistant professor Rebecca Singer Chicago Tribune | Sept. 15, 2020 [Vaping ban: Huge win or missed opportunity?](https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/breaking/ct-vaping-flavored-tobacco-ban-20200915-gkdnvikq2fd5nohsdibtcz5cjq-story.html) Featuring Phoenix Matthews, Assoc. Dean for Equity and Inclusion Chicago Tribune | Sept. 3, 2020 [Flavored tobacco ban is crucial — and must include menthol cigarettes](https://www.chicagotribune.com/opinion/commentary/ct-opinion-smoking-flavored-tobacco-menthol-cigarettes-20200903-qnybfkcrp5cxtgg5jls6bvfta4-story.html) Op-ed by Phoenix Matthews, Assoc. Dean for Equity and Inclusion WBEZ | Sept. 1, 2020 [Women have few options for giving birth on the south side. Two midwives want to change that.](https://www.wbez.org/stories/women-have-few-options-for-giving-birth-on-the-south-side-two-midwives-want-to-change-that/e2f2a774-5cf9-4f41-a53f-4261aede5ec3) Featuring alumna Karie Stewart, MS '17 Chicago Tribune | Aug. 28, 2020 [Chicago still doesn't have standalone birthing centers, even as options for pregnant women on the South and West sides are dwindling](https://www.chicagotribune.com/living/health/ct-life-pregnant-south-west-sides-delivery-illinois-birthing-centers-20200828-cyax76bjozhi7beftnwnudcp2e-story.html) Featuring alumna Karie Stewart, MS '17 National News [Heading link](#national-news) Jezebel | June 21, 2022 [We Are Losing Black Girls](https://jezebel.com/suicide-rate-black-girls-increasing-1848977884) This article, which cites research published by assistant professor [Natasha Crooks](https://nursing.uic.edu/profiles/crooks-natasha/), PhD, RN, examines rising rates of suicide among black girls. Yahoo Finance | Feb. 10, 2022 [Medical District Innovation: Lab Gives Nursing Students Hands-On Skills](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/medical-district-innovation-lab-gives-215400826.html?guccounter=1) A shared [Illinois Medical District press release](https://illinoismedicaldistrict.newsroom-online.com/2022/01/31/medical-district-innovation-lab-gives-nursing-students-hands-on-skills/) detailing UIC College of Nursing's various clinical simulation resources, including the [M. Christine Schwartz Experiential Learning & Simulation Laboratory](https://nursing.uic.edu/student-life/schwartz-lab/) Becker's Healthcare | July 26, 2021 [Illinois university creates partnership between dental, nursing schools to benefit pediatric patients](https://www.beckersdental.com/dentists/36977-illinois-university-creates-partnership-between-dental-nursing-schools-to-benefit-pediatric-patients.html) Coverage of UIC Nursing's partnership with UIC Dentistry to provide required health screenings for pediatric dental patients 1A (NPR) | June 16, 2021 [Putting The B In LGBTQ](https://the1a.org/segments/putting-the-b-in-lgbtq/) Featuring assoc. professor Wendy Bostwick U.S. News & World Report | Feb. 16, 2021 [Pandemic Has People Cleaning, and That Means More Asthma Attacks](https://www.usnews.com/news/health-news/articles/2021-02-16/pandemic-has-people-cleaning-and-that-means-more-asthma-attacks) Featuring the research of assoc. professor Kamal Eldeirawi - - more Vice.com | Feb. 12, 2021 [Sex workers are fighting to get the COVID vaccine](https://www.vice.com/en/article/k7a53v/sex-workers-are-fighting-to-get-the-covid-vaccine) Citing a call-to-action co-authored by faculty researchers Randi Singer, Natasha Crooks and Phoenix Matthews MSN / WUSA9 | Aug. 30, 2020 [Black Nurses Matter march on DC streets helps fight for health disparities in Black community](https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/us/black-nurses-matter-march-on-dc-streets-helps-fight-for-health-disparities-in-black-community/ar-BB18vc2P) Featuring alumna Alysha Hart, PhD '20 International News [Heading link](#international-news) Advance, A program of Government Information Service of Grenada | Sept. 12, 2022 [Episode: Men's Health](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AxMJ79iHdto) Featuring Rohan Jeremiah, interim assoc. dean for global health Bubb Report (Caribbean) | June 21, 2020 [Balancing COVID-19 with Caribbean Reopening](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0i2lzoz3ERw&feature=youtu.be) (video) Featuring assoc. professor Rohan Jeremiah Specialty Medical Dialogues (India)| Dec. 8, 2019 [Ultrasound can identify risk of preterm birth early](https://speciality.medicaldialogues.in/ultrasound-can-identify-risk-of-preterm-birth-early?infinitescroll=1) Featuring professor Barbara McFarlin Industry News [Heading link](#industry-news) Diverse | July 5, 2023 [Seeking Equity in Healthcare Education](https://www.diverseeducation.com/awards-honors/graduate-scholars/2023/article/15541472/seeking-equity-in-healthcare-education) PhD student Sabrina Ali Jamal-Eddine is profiled in this feature article. American Heart Association News | March 17, 2023 [These healthy habits might also lead to a happier life](https://www.heart.org/en/news/2023/03/17/these-healthy-habits-might-also-lead-to-a-happier-life) Associate dean and professor [Rosalba Hernandez](https://nursing.uic.edu/profiles/hernandez-rosalba/) is quoted in this American Heart Association News story Endocrine Today | Jan. 11, 2023 [Behavioral sleep intervention may improve sleep duration, regularity in type 1 diabetes](https://www.healio.com/news/endocrinology/20230110/behavioral-sleep-intervention-may-improve-sleep-duration-regularity-in-type-1-diabetes) Article summarizing a pilot study led by associate professor [Pamela Martyn-Nemeth](https://nursing.uic.edu/profiles/pamela-martyn-nemeth/), PhD, RN, FAHA, FAAN, that was originally published in the peer-reviewed journal The Science of Diabetes Self-Management and Care. Nursing | Dec. 1, 2022 [Nurse-led strategies to decrease preoperative Vortman](https://nursing.uic.edu/profiles/dr-rebecca-vortman-dnp-rn-cnor/), DNP, RN, CNOR, NEA-BC, responds to a question regarding ways to ease anxiety in patients awaiting surgery. Nursing Educator Podcast | Nov. 2, 2022 [Nursing Handoff Education Using Experiential and Virtual Innovations](https://nurseeducatorpodcast.libsyn.com/nursing-handoff-education-using-experiential-and-virtual-innovations) Nursing Educator Podcast episode featuring a discussion with clinical assistant professor [Kathryn Vanderzwan](https://nursing.uic.edu/profiles/kathryn-vanderzwan/) DNP, APRN, CHSE, about recent innovations in nursing education curriculum. - - more Vanguard Law Magazine| May 25, 2022 [Anthony Wilson - Silver Cross Hospital](https://www.vanguardlawmag.com/case-studies/anthony-wilson-silver-cross-hospital/) Feature article about alumnus Anthony Wilson, BSN' 04, chief corporate compliance officer and director of ERM at Silver Cross Hospital in New Lenox, Illinois. Microfinance News Today | May 16, 2022 [Gay Landstrom, SVP and Chief Nursing Officer at Trinity Health, Joins Hallmark Health Care Solutions' Board of Directors](https://microfinance.einnews.com/pr_news/572038876/gay-landstrom-svp-and-chief-nursing-officer-at-trinity-health-joins-hallmark-health-care-solutions-board-of-directors) Published press release about alumna Gay Landstrom, MS '88, joining the Hallmark Health Care Solutions Board of Directors. OR Today Magazine | May 1, 2022 [Spotlight On: Marisa Streelman, MS '12. U.S. News & World Report | March 29, 2022 [U.S. News Ranks 2023 Best Graduate Schools](https://www.usnews.com/education/best-graduate-schools/articles/us-news-ranks-best-graduate-schools?utm_source=usn_tw&utm_campaign=tw_edu) Rankings of this year's top-rated graduate schools, including UIC Nursing's No. 13 ranked master's program, No. 11 ranked DNP program and No. 8 ranked AG-ACNP program. Medpage Today's KevinMD.com | Feb. 22, 2022 [Nurses are in need of racial healing](https://www.kevinmd.com/blog/2022/02/nurses-are-in-need-of-racial-healing.html) Editorial written by alumna Janice Phillips, PhD '93, RN Diverse Issues in Higher Education | Feb. 17, 2022 [Meeting the Need: How Nursing Schools Are Addressing the RN Shortage Exacerbated by COVID-19](https://www.diverseeducation.com/health/article/15288476/meeting-the-need-how-nursing-schools-are-addressing-the-rn-shortage-exacerbated-by-covid19) Featuring comments by [Kate Treadway](https://nursing.uic.edu/profiles/catherine-tredway/), director of the RN-BSN degree completion program Anatomy Now | Dec. 15, 2021 [2022 Annual Meeting Plenary Speaker: Dr. Julienne Rutherford on How Early Environments Impact Development and Success](https://amasan.informz.net/informzdataservice/onlineversion/ind/bWFpbGluZ2luc3RhbmNlaWQ9ODU4NTYwNiZzdWJzY3JpYmVyaWQ9OTIxMTQ4ODM3) Profile of associate professor [Julienne Rutherford](https://nursing.uic.edu/profiles/julienne-rutherford/), PhD. Healio | Oct. 1, 2021 [Black Nurses Matter: On the Frontlines](https://journals.healio.com/doi/full/10.3928/02793695-20210914-01) Guest editorial written by alumna and postdoctoral research associate Alysha Hart, PhD '20 Pulmonology Advisor | Oct. 14, 2021 [Nurse-Led Program Boosts Medication Adherence Discussions](https://www.pulmonologyadvisor.com/home/topics/practice-management/nurse-led-program-boosts-medication-adherence-discussions/) An article detailing the research and efforts of clinical professor [Valerie Gruss](https://nursing.uic.edu/profiles/valerie-gruss/), PhD, APRN, CNP-BC, FAAN, to develop an education program on improving medication adherence American Board of Medical Specialties - Press Release | Aug. 18, 2021 [Amy Gibson, MS, RN Joins ABMS as Vice President, Policy and Public Affairs](https://www.abms.org/news-events/amy-gibson-ms-rn-joins-abms-as-vice-president-policy-and-public-affairs/) Press release from the American Board of Medical Specialties naming alumna Amy Gibson, BSN '93, as vice president of policy and public affairs. The Journal of Blacks in Higher Education | Aug. 18, 2021 [Higher Education Grants or Gifts of Interest to African Americans](https://www.jbhe.com/2021/08/higher-education-grants-or-gifts-of-interest-to-african-americans-232/) An article highlighting the Midwest Nursing History Research Center's recent grant to create the Chicago Black Nurses Archive Mapping project The Cancer Letter | June 25, 2021 [Fly the pride flag—and free the LGBTQ+ community from the oppression of smoking](https://cancerletter.com/guest-editorial/20210625_3/) A guest editorial written by Phoenix Matthews, associate dean for equity and inclusion American Healthcare Leader | June 28, 2021 [Catherine Garvey Goldthorpe Will Always Be a Nurse profile of alumna Catherine Garvey Goldthorpe, JD, BSN '84 The Cancer Letter | May 7, 2021 [Menthol ban has been a no-brainer for decades—will it finally happen?](https://cancerletter.com/guest-editorial/20210507_1/) A guest editorial co-written by [Phoenix Matthews](https://nursing.uic.edu/profiles/phoenix-matthews/), associate dean for equity and inclusion Chronicle of Higher Education | Apr. 27, 2021 [Race on Campus: How to Be a More Inclusive Mentor](https://www.chronicle.com/newsletter/race-on-campus/2021-04-27) Featuring executive associate dean Susan Corbridge and Phoenix Matthews, associate dean for equity and inclusion Leader to Leader: News from the National Council of State Boards of Nursing | Spring 2021 [An Historic Moment for Nursing Students](https://www.ncsbn.org/15850.htm) Featuring instructor Jennie Van Schyndel and students Presches Keck and Karly Schmitz, p. 7-8 Illinois Association of Colleges of Nursing | Mar. 13, 2021 [Strengthening Nurse Presence in Public Health](http://illinoiscollegesofnursing.org/2021/03/13/strengthening-nurse-presence-in-public-health/) Quoting Dean Terri Weaver American Nurses Association - Illinois | Mar. 7, 2021 [Reporting on Lauren Underwood's appearance at UIC Nursing](https://www.il-nurses.com/nurses4nurses/) American College of Cardiology - Journal Scan | Feb. 18, 2021 [Suicide Risk Management Protocol for Patients With Ischemic CVD Who Report Hopelessness](https://nam04.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.acc.org%2Flatest-in-cardiology%2Fjournal-scans%2F2021%2F02%2F18%2F16%2F54%2Fsuicide-risk-management-protocol-for-patients-with-ischemic-cvd-who-report-hopelessness&data=04%7C01%7Clhmiller%40uic.edu%7C80f835cac20e4a4fc4c808d8d4ed283d%7Ce202cd477a564baa99e3e3b71a7c77dd%7C0%7C0%7C637493462327604225%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=RO5qolsgb1MxCkuw25yJScXQk79Jm1JScriPRPdxziA%3D&reserved=0) Featuring the research of assoc. professor Susan Dunn Healthy Schools Campaign | Sept. 23, 2020 [Saluting our School Nurse Leaders](https://healthyschoolscampaign.org/blog/saluting-our-school-nurse-leaders/) Featuring clinical professor emerita Martha Dewey Bergren and retired director of the school nurse certificate program Phyllis Pelt, MS '95, BSN '67 Psych Congress Network | July 15, 2020 [How COVID-19 is Affecting the Mental Health of Children and Adolescents](https://www.psychcongress.com/multimedia/how-covid-19-affecting-mental-health-children-and-adolescents) Featuring clinical
